trait.name: Invigorating Knowledge
entries: Learning new things or successfully applying existing knowledge grants Barabak an inspiring feeling of satisfaction. When he succeeds on an Intelligence check, or a creature he aids with the Help action succeeds on an Intelligence check, he can gain temporary hit points equal to twice his Intelligence modifier (Minimum of 1).

trait.name: Studious Slasher
entries: Barabak uses Intelligence in place of Strength when attacking with slashing weapons (included in the attack).

trait.name: Scholarly Expertise
entries: Barabak doubles his proficiency bonus, provided he doesn't already, for any checks relating to Trenin politics and to mercantile.

trait.name: Trivial Arcanecraft
entries: Barabak can cast the following spells at-will; {@spell dancing lights|phb}, {@spell detect magic|phb}, {@spell message|phb} or {@spell shocking grasp}. Intelligence is his spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Arcanecraft (3/Long Rest)
entries: Barabak can cast one of the following spells at 3rd-level; {@spell analyze weakness|J:lore}, {@spell borrowed knowledge|scc}, {@spell color spray|phb}, {@spell counterspell|phb}, {@spell darklight|J:Lore}, {@spell illusory script}, {@spell stagger/sunder|J:lore}, or {@spell sending|phb}. Intelligence is his spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Barabak has proficiency with the following; {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, {@item cartographer's tools|phb}, {@item forgery kit|phb} and {@item dragonchess set|phb}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Baraback makes two weapon attacks, he can replace one of these attacks with a use of Tactical Guide.

action.name: Kopis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Baba's Axe
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tactical Guide (5/Long Rest)
entries: Barabak chooses a creature he can see within 30 feet that can see or hear him. That creature can immediately take one of the following actions as a reaction:

items: One weapon attack. On a hit, the attack deals an additional {@dice 1d8} damage.
Move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Attempt to break out of a grapple. The creature has a {@dice 1d8} bonus to the check.
Cast a cantrip with a casting time of 1 action or bonus action.

action.name: Group Maneuvers (1/Long Rest)
entries: Barabak chooses up to four creatures he can see within 30 feet. Each chosen creature can use its reaction to move up to half its movement and take one action or one bonus action.

action.name: That was the plan all along (1/1)
entries: Barabak retroactively causes something beneficial to happen. The effect must be something within reason for Barabak, the Birds of Prey or their agents to have achieved, even if it requires incredible foresight. For example, he might declare that agents have already unlocked a door ahead of time, eliminated or distracted a small group of guards, discovered a secret passage or something else the DM deems appropriate.

bonus.name: Helpful
entries: Barabak takes the {@action Help} action. he can target a creature up 30 feet away.

Barabak is the owner and barkeep of the Flaming Talon bastion. He is also the leader and tactician of the Birds of Prey. With some talents in martial combat and the arcane arts, Barabak's biggest strength is his strategic mind. Whether its managing a tavern, playing dragon chess or planning an insurection, Barabak is rather gifted.

Barabak's grandmother, Baba, lives with him and sometimes works in the Flaming Talon. While clearly elderly and sometimes spacey, Baba has lived a rich life, occassionaly regaling the more patient patron with tales of adventuring and combat.

trait.name: Dwarvern Resilience
entries: Gimmer has advantage on saving throws against posion damage and the {@condition poisoned|phb} condition, and has resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Dirty Strike (5/Long Rest)
entries: When Gimmer hits a creature with an attack, he can deal an additional 1d10 damage and impose one of the following effects (DC equals 8 + PB + Strength modifier):

items: The target makes a Strength saving throw or is knocked {@condition prone}.
The target makes a Strength saving throw or is knocked 15 feet away from Gimmer.
The target makes a Dexterity saving throw or is {@condition sundered|J:general} (if piercing) or {@condition staggered|J:general} (if bludgeoning) until the start of Gimmer's next turn.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Gimmer has proficiency with the following; {@item mason's tools|phb}, {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item bagpipes|phb} and {@item dice set|phb}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gimmer makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Pick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shovel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Miner Mob (1/1)
entries: A group of miners, including Gimmer and Lyeslyn, are roused into performing a favour for you. The favour must be something reasonable for a mob of workers to achieve, such as small protest or riot, hiding something in the mines or damaging an unguarded structure made of stone. Lyeslyn will make sure the mob scatters before they are in real danger.

bonus.name: Scrapper
entries: Gimmer takes the {@action Grapple} or {@action Shove} action.

bonus.name: Second Wind (1/Long Rest)
entries: Gimmer regains 30 hit points

reaction.name: Revenger's Mark (3/Long Rest)
entries: When a creature deals damage to Gimmer or he fails a saving throw imposed by them, Gimmer can use a reaction to cast {@spell Hunter's Mark|PHB} against the creature. Damage does not break Gimmer's concentration in this spell.
Gimmer is a miner, and also a warrior within the Birds of Prey. While stocky and strong like many laboring dwarves, Gimmer is cunning and known to fight dirty.

Gimmer lives with his parents. His mother, Lyeslyn, is also a miner and commands much respect within the Stone District. His father, Sarthel, is a baker and the homemaker of the family. Together the family took Thena Bea Dakestus in, during her first time in Trenin, giving her the family she never really had at home.

trait.name: Enchanting Melodies
entries: Helith can cast the following cantrips at will; {@spell message|phb}, {@spell prestidigitation|phb} and {@spell vicious mockery|phb}. Charisma is her spellcasting ability for these cantrips.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Helith has proficiency with the following; {@item calligrapher's supplies|phb}, {@item drum|phb}, {@item flute|phb}, {@item lute|phb}, {@item lyre|phb}, {@item pan flute|phb} and {@item playing cards|phb}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Blowgun Flute
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Disorienting Song (3/Long Rest)
entries: Helith chooses a creature she can see and forces them to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + Wisdom modifier). On a fail, a creature gains one of the following conditions for 1 minute or until Helith loses concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). A creature can repeat the saving at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.

items: {@condition Charmed|phb} by an ally Helith chooses. The condition is removed early if the charmer damages the charmed creature.
{@condition Distracted|J:General}.
{@condition Frightened|phb} by an ally Helith chooses.
{@condition Taunted|J:General} by an ally Helith chooses. The condition is removed early if the creature is damaged by a creature other than the taunter.

action.name: Crowd Work (1/Long Rest)
entries: Helith targets up to 6 creatures she can see within 30 feet and that can hear her. Each creature has a {@dice 1d6} bonus or penalty (Helith's choice for each creature) to all ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws they make for 1 minute.

action.name: I'll pluck a few strings (1/1)
entries: Helith calls upon her connections within the Golden Lyre to gain some favor. The favor must be something feasible for a network of bards to achieve, such as calling a troupe of performers to distract a group, spreading a coded message or rumor or anything else the DM deems appropriate.

bonus.name: (De)Motivate (5/Long Rest)
entries: Helith chooses a creature she can see within 30 feet and that can hear her. That creature has a 1d6 bonus or penalty (Helith's choice) on the next ability check, attack roll or saving throw they make before Helith's next turn.

Helith is a human bard, member of the Golden Lyre, and member of the Birds of Prey, Helith is something of a gossiper, and her connections to the Golden Lyre only enhance this. Helith is remarkably capable of wielding this trait to spread and gather information quickly and broadly, greatly aiding the Birds of Prey.

Helith served as something of a mentor for Thena Bea Dakestus during her first time in Trenin, guiding her both in music, Apollo worship and even magic. Its not hard to argue that Thena has vastly surpassed Helith in magic, but Helith is perhaps still the stronger musician.

trait.name: Beefy Cowgirl
entries: Leafa has advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Improvised Shield
entries: Leafa can use miscellaneous items to gain a +2 bonus to her Armor Class.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Leafa has proficiency with the following; {@item carpenter's tool|phb}, {@item woodcarver's tools|phb}, vehicles and {@item dice set|phb}.

trait.name: Controled Rage
entries: Having faced many hardships, Leafa is good at keeping her anger in check, but might sometimes be tested. At the DM's discretion, Leafa might make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw at the start of her turn to remain calm. On a fail, Leafa must use her Enrage! trait. The DC increases for each friendly creature Leafa can see that is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} (increased by 2), or {@variantrule Dead|XPHB} (increased by 5).
The DM might also decide that Leafa automatically, or even willing, fails this saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Leafa makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Improvised Heavy Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Charge (3/Long Rest)
entries: Leafa runs up to 30 feet in a straight line and then makes a Horns attack. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks and can move through the space of Large or smaller creatures. Any creature who's space she moves through must chose between falling {@condition prone} or taking {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage. Leafa cannot take this action if her speed is 0.

action.name: I Got Friends (1/1)
entries: Leafa calls in a favour in the South Docks. The favour must be something a criminal orginsation or a network of dock workers can reasonably achieve with little risk, such as smuggling a person or contraband, threatening a business owner, acquiring a vehicle or delaying shipments.

bonus.name: Enrage! (1/Long Rest)
entries: Leafa is good at keeping her temper in check, but if she does let go, you'd better not be in the way. She gains the following effects for the next 10 minutes, until she is knocked {@condition unconscious}, or she calms down (decided by the DM):

items: Leafa loses most of her rational thinking and becomes overwhelmingly dedicated to a particular destructive goal, such as killing a particular enemy or destroying a particular object. Any creatures attempting to stop her may be seen as hostile, regardless of their previous relationship.
Leafa has advantage on all attack rolls and ability checks related to pursuing her goal.
Leafa's Strength score becomes 24.
Leafa has resistance to all damage.
Leafa's speed becomes 60 feet.
If a section of a nonmagical structure has 15 AC or lower, has 30 hit points or fewer and is less than 1 foot thick, Leafa can move through it as difficult terrain. This includes most wooden walls.

reaction.name: Can't keep me down! (5/LR)
entries: When Leafa fails a saving throw or takes damage, she can use a reaction to reroll the saving throw or gain resistance to the triggering damage.

Leafa is a minotaur dock worker, working many odd jobs. Her hulky form naturally gets her lots of work in heavy lifting, but she is also skilled in woodworking and driving. She is also a member of the Birds of Prey, where these skills, along with the connections she makes in the South Docks, are greatly useful to the group.

Minotaurs are not common in Trenin. Combined with the general hardships of commonfolk in Trenin, Leafa faces many frustrations and challenges. Leafa has to manage her anger carefully to avoid making things worse. In spite of all this, Leafa is incredibly friendly and often the most chipper in the room. Just don't get in her way when she does let go.

trait.name: Glamorous
entries: Over the course of 10 minutes, Peto can transform into Cloud Nine or back into Peto. As Cloud Nine, they have advantage on Charisma checks and saving throws, but has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and their speed is reduced by 10 feet due to high heels.

trait.name: One-armed Bandit
entries: Peto is missing their left arm, however, they can use their dexterity and air current control to componsate. They can climb effectively, wield weapons as if they were using two hands and can still attack while grappling one creature.

trait.name: Currents (5/Long Rest)
entries: When Peto takes the Attack or Dash action on their turn, Peto can apply the {@condition weighted|J:general} or {@condition lightened|J:general} condition to either themself or a creature they hit with an attack for 1 minute, or until Peto ends it (no action required).
Alternatively, Peto can use this trait on themself as a reaction to being {@condition grappled} or falling.

trait.name: Starstruck Strike (3/Long Rest)
entries: When Peto hits a creature with a weapon attack, they can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + Charisma modifier) or become {@condition stunned|phb} until the start of Peto's next turn. On a success, the creature is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} for the duration instead.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Peto has proficiency with the following; {@item diguise kit|phb}, {@item thieves' tools|phb}, {@item bagpipes|phb}, {@item flute|phb}, and {@item playing cards|phb}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Leafa makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Glass Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Everyone on Cloud Nine (1/1)
entries: Cloud Nine rallies her fans to a cause, such as spreading misinformation, distributing small items to the public, or leading a chant in public. The fans will not willingly put themselves in obvious danger.

bonus.name: Breezy Action
entries: Peto takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action, or makes a melee attack.

bonus.name: Wind under Wings (1/Long Rest)
entries: Peto gains a flying speed equal to their walking speed for 1 minute.
Alternatively, Peto can touch another creature and cast the {@spell levitate|phb} spell on them.

reaction.name: Sailing Load
entries: When Peto, or a creature they can see within 30 feet, makes a Strength (Athletics) check, Peto can use a reaction to give the roll advantage or disadvantage (Peto's choice) as they summon winds to help or hinder the effort.

Peto is a nimble air genasi with command or air currents. Like the rest of the Birds of Prey, Peto has a grievance with the current government and police of Trenin. Even among the Birds of Prey, Peto has a rather relaxed attitude to maiming and killing nobles, greycapes and bluecapes, possibly even taking joy from it.

Peto has a drag persona known as Cloud Nine. Cloud Nine is a local celebrity performer and boasts a small but loyal following. Cloud Nine appears far more confident and performative than Peto, but also less cautious, sometimes getting carried away by the performance.

trait.name: Princess and Pauper
entries: Over the course of a minute, Penny transforms her appearance and demeanour into one of the following guises, which last until she uses this trait again:

items.name: Lady Penelope
entries: Appearing as a prim and proper noble of Rubin, Penelope has advantage on abilty checks made to socially interact with, or blend in with, nobles and creatures who respect nobility and wealth, however, she has disadvantage on such checks with those who dislike nobility and wealth.

items.name: Penny
entries: Appearing as a simple, and sometimes drunk, commoner, Penny has advantage on abilty checks made to socially interact with, or blend in with, working class folk, especially those who dislike nobles and frequent alehouses, however, she has disadvantage on such checks with those who value nobility and wealth.

trait.name: Drinking Game Master
entries: Penelope has advantage on saving throws against posion damage and the {@condition poisoned|phb} condition, and has resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Penelope has proficiency with the following; {@item thieves' tools|phb}, harp, {@item flute|phb}, and {@item playing cards|phb}.

action.name: Improvised Shiv
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition distracted|J:general} until the start of Penelope's next turn.

action.name: Improvised Thrown Weapon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Feint or Faint (3/Long Rest)
entries: When Penelope is within 5 feet of a humanoid creature, she can do one of the following:

items.name: Damesel in Distress (Lady Penelope Only)
entries: Penelope accuses the creature of attacking or offending her, crying out for help from a second humanoid within 30 feet that can see or hear her. The second creature must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equals 8 + PB + Charisma modifier) or view the first creature as hostile and spend an action on its next turn reprimanding, grappling or even attacking the first creature (DM's discretion). Afterwhich, the second creature might no longer see the first as hostile. A creature that dislikes nobility or sees Penelope as hostile has advantage on the saving throw.

items.name: Distracting Troublemaker (Penny Only)
entries: Penny distracts the creature with pocket sand, misleading feints or rude insults. Attack rolls made by other creatures against the target have advantage until the start of Penny's next turn, until she is more than 5 feet from the creature, or an attack hits the creature. When an attack roll hits the creature, Penny can use a reaction to make the attack deal an additional {@dice 2d6} damage and she can move up to half her movement without provoking opportunity attacks as part of the same reaction.

action.name: Belittle or Bewilder (1/Long Rest)
entries: Either by barking misleading and contradictory orders as Lady Penelope or employing various dirty tricks and feints as Penny, Penelope casts the {@spell confusion|xphb} spell at 5th-level (DC equals 8 + PB + Charisma Modifier).

action.name: Money makes the world go round (1/1)
entries: Penelope can use her noble connections to call in a favour. The favour must be something that can be achieved with the status or wealth of minor nobility, such as acquiring a valuable antique, bribing an official, or something else the DM deems appropriate.

bonus.name: Dainty Light Fingers (5/Long Rest)
entries: Penny forces a creature within 5 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC + PB + Charisma modifier). On a fail, Penny steals one of the following items from the creature, she can throw the item up to 15 feet as part of the same bonus action:

items: One item being held or loosely carried by the creature.

An important or sentimental item. The creature is distracted until they retrieve it. In addition, as a bonus action within the next 10 minutes, a creature holding the item that can be seen by the target can force the target to repeat the saving throw. On a fail, the target is {@condition taunted|J:general} by the creature holding the item until the end of the target's next turn.
A random treasure or tricket worth gp equal to twice the creature's CR.
A {@item Potion of Healing|dmg}. It ceases to be magical after one hour.

entries: Alternatively, Penny can plant a tiny item she is holding on the person.

bonus.name: Just a Commoner (Penny Only)
entries: Penny can {@action Hide} as a bonus action. She can also attempt to hide in a crowded area such as a markeplace or tavern. When she does so, she can make a Charisma (Deception) check in place of a Dexterity (Stealth). Being visible does not necessarily reveal her location so long as she acts as part of the normal crowd.

bonus.name: Fear of Friends in High Places (Lady Penelope Only)
entries: Penelope uses her status and connections to instil hesitation in her enemies. Until the start of Penelope's next turn, she has a bonus to her Armor Class and Wisdom saving throws equal to her Charisma modifier.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When Penelope takes damage from an attack, she can use a reaction to half the damage she takes.
Lady Penelope is a minor noble lady from Rubin.

Despite the luxuries of her station, Penelope is never truly satisfied with that life. She occasionally takes on the persona of Penny the Urchin, a commoner who frequents alehouses, enjoying the drink and company. As Penny, she can blend in remarkably well.

trait.name: Rapport Spores
entries: Yavius can telepathically communicate with creatures within 30 feet.

trait.name: Undercover Artist
entries: Yavius can cast {@spell disguise self|phb} (DC equals 8 + PB + Constitution modifier) at will.

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Yavius has proficiency with the following; {@item painter's supplies|phb} and {@item calligrapher's supplies|phb}.

action.name: Painted Net
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one Large or smaller target. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained|phb} until it is freed. The creature, or another creature within 5 feet, can make a Strength (Athletics) check (DC 8 + PB + Constitution modifier) to break it free. Dealing 5 acid or slashing damage to the net also frees the creature.

action.name: Posion Spores
entries: Yavius chooses a creature they can see within 15 feet. the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + PB + Constitution modifier) or take {@damage 3d12} poison damage. A creature takes half damage on a success.

action.name: Pacifying Spores (3/Long Rest)
entries: Yavius chooses a creature they can see within 5 feet. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + PB + Constitution modifier) or be {@condition Stunned|phb} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: You'll need a hero! (1/Long Rest)
entries: Yavius creates 1 Enchanted Eden Mauler or 15 First Dawn Maulers in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet. The maulers act independently and are hostile to all non-mauler creatures. The maulers fade after one minute or when they reach 0 hit points.

action.name: Masterpiece (1/1)
entries: Yavius creates and distrubtes a great work, or series of works. The work might persuade groups of people to rally to a particular cause, or might pass a distribute a secret message to a wide audience.

bonus.name: Oil Object (5/Long Rest)
entries: Yavius creates a non-magical object that fits within a 5-foot cube. The creation may appear like multiple separate objects or a larger object folded up, but it is still treated as a single rigid and opaque object. The object is clearly painted, has an AC of 15 and 10 hit points. It is immune to poison and psychic damage but vulnerable to acid damage. It is also immune to all conditions. The object disappears after 10 minutes or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.
Yavius is a famous painter in Trenin, known for impressionist paintings of lone heroes standing up to giant threats, such as monsters and hordes.
A secret known only to a few is that Yavius is not actually a single person, but a fungal colony acting as one. They employ disguises and agents to hide their true nature from the public.
